div.p: Sub-tag available in BIOGRAPHY FAMILY , but only within MARRIAGE (n.b. not available in Member tags within Family, i.e. tag only if itâ€™s the entry subject who is separated, not a relative or friend). Separation captures information concerning the marital conditions of the subject of your biography. Use this element to indicate that a woman separated legally or officially from her husband without a divorce. (Sometimes the DIVORCE tag may be used later of the same relationship.)

div.codeblock: <separation>Fanny Kemble signed a formal separation agreement, after disputes over child custody and Butler's harsh conditions for support.</> <separation>ALB separated from her husband in response to her family's increasing entreaties to consider her own safety, realising that she was unable to help him, and that her presence worsened his condition. She felt strongly that Rochement's violence was caused by illness. In letters to friends, ALB stated that she felt no less affection for her husband, and she was most reluctant and sad to separate from him.</>

div.p: Only use for the separation of the person whose biography you are writing. Do NOT use for parents, cousins or any other family member. Using this element denotes that the subject of the document was separated from her/his spouse.
